posts.post_content:
8 mana for total game domination... this thing can byp\*\*\* most things without leaving a single drawback; besides, he is NICOL BOLAS!  
okok, you're right: 8 mana is a kick in the darn, but well, get this guy into the battlefield and ask gentlemanly to your opponent "do you concede or do I have to make you suffer?".  
Another good point is the non-Nicol Bolas elder dragon-cost (2UUBBRR); but its main problem is that it joins the battle too late, beside that this thing alone can handle your foe whole deck.

Posted By: Neutralion (1/30/2010 6:22:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A supply of endless "destroy enchantment" effects that can also take annoying equipment off the board or destroy lands would be good enough, but he can even take over enemy creatures. Those alone would be worth eight mana as far as I'm concerned, but then he can unleash a powered-up version of Cruel Ultimatum, which not only deals fairly noticable damage and forces your opponent to discard their entire hand, but will likely force them to either mana-screw themselves or clear the table of blockers, allowing you to end the game in that combat phase. God I love this card.
posts.html:
A supply of endless "destroy enchantment" effects that can also take annoying equipment off the board or destroy lands would be good enough, but he can even take over enemy creatures. Those alone would be worth eight mana as far as I'm concerned, but then he can unleash a powered-up version of Cruel Ultimatum, which not only deals fairly noticable damage and forces your opponent to discard their entire hand, but will likely force them to either mana-screw themselves or clear the table of blockers, allowing you to end the game in that combat phase. God I love this card.

Posted By: SocialExperiment (7/13/2009 1:28:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I rated him five because he's Nicol Bolas. He bit Teferi in the head and showed him who's boss. Then beat up Leshrac and did the same. He's probably killed more planeswalkers then all other factors combined. Heck, his freaking first ability just outright kills them. And people thought Chandra was good at suppressing enemy walkers. Playwise, he's hard to get out and doesn't win the game as fast as Cruel Ultimatum or whatever, but don't forget, he's casting that spell in it's artwork. Points for Bolas.

Posted By: BlackAlbino (3/6/2010 8:38:20 PM)

posts.post_content:
Ever been Nicol Bolased turn 2? Its great fun  
Turn 1  
Forest, [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise)  
Turn 2  
[Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra), Fetchland, Sac Fetchland, Lotus Cobra, [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile) the birds, [Explore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Explore), Fetchland, Sac Fetchland, Explore, Fetchland, Sac Fetchland. **NICOL BOLAS**  
That right there is how you can make someone stop playing Magic for ever, the only problem i have found is that the second turn Bolas requires exactly 11 cards, so you have to go second, and you have to draw fetchlands off of your Explores.  
can anyone name a card that removes Nicol Bolas for 2 mana? the only 1 i can think of is [Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage), so as long as your not versing vampires or mbc then the game is in the bag.  
  
ps: the chance of having the exact 7 spells and drawing 3 fetchlands and a forest or 4 fetchlands is about 1 in 20, so good luck :)  
  
@Ezenthar, yes you're correct, as I found out the hard way. turns... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
